com.exlibris.dps.repository.plugin

Interface CustomFixityPlugin


  • public interface CustomFixityPlugin
    Plugin for user defined fixity (checksum).
    This plugin interface only supports java implementation.
    Author:
    PeterK

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAgent()
      Returns the agent name.
      java.lang.String getAlgorithm()
      Returns the fixity algorithm.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getErrors()
      Returns list of mismatches detected during fixity calculation.
      java.lang.String getFixity(java.lang.String filePath, java.lang.String oldFixity)
      Calculates and returns fixity for the given file.

    • Method Detail

      • getFixity

        java.lang.String getFixity(java.lang.String filePath,
                           java.lang.String oldFixity)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates and returns fixity for the given file. If the old fixity isn't null and the new fixity doesn't match it, it is possible to add a list of detailed errors to help identify the source of the problem.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path to the file
        oldFixity - the value of the previous fixity on this file, null if this is the first time this type of fixity is calculated on the file
        Returns:
        the new fixity
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - on any error during the actual fixity calculation

      • getAlgorithm

        java.lang.String getAlgorithm()
        Returns the fixity algorithm.
        Returns:
        The name of the algorithm this plugin calculates

      • getAgent

        java.lang.String getAgent()
        Returns the agent name.
        Returns:
        The agent of the plugin type

      • getErrors

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getErrors()
        Returns list of mismatches detected during fixity calculation. These errors should include additional information when the checksum values mismatch. For example: checksum diff or possible location of file difference.
        Any other errors (like IOException during checksum calculation) should be thrown.
        Returns:
        list of mismatches detected during fixity calculation.
